sentiment_score_definition: x <= -0.35: Bearish; -0.35 < x <= -0.15: Somewhat-Bearish; -0.15 < x < 0.15: Neutral; 0.15 <= x < 0.35: Somewhat_Bullish; x >= 0.35: Bullish
relevance_score_definition: 0 < x <= 1, with a higher score indicating higher relevance.

feed.title: Trump Media Moves $174 Million Worth Of Bitcoin Amid $6 Billion Merger Plans
feed.summary: Trump Media & Technology Group, owner of Truth Social, has moved approximately 2,000 Bitcoin (BTC) worth $174 million across wallets just a day after increasing its crypto holdings. This activity follows the company's agreement to merge with TAE Technologies in a $6 billion all-stock transaction and its earlier announcement to acquire cryptocurrencies. The move appears to be a reallocation rather than a centralized exchange transfer, and Bitcoin traders remained largely unfazed.

feed.title: Trump Media Moves $174 Million Worth Of Bitcoin Amid $6 Billion Merger Plans
feed.summary: Trump Media & Technology Group, owner of Truth Social, recently adjusted its Bitcoin holdings. This move comes shortly after an increase in its crypto assets and amidst its ongoing $6 billion merger plans.

feed.title: BTC News: Donald Trump owned media firm moves 2,000 bitcoin, worth $174 million
feed.summary: Trump Media and Technology Group (DJT) moved approximately 2,000 bitcoin, valued at $174 million, across various wallets after increasing its holdings. The transfers included about $12 million reaching Coinbase Prime Custody, with the remainder staying in wallets linked to the same entity, suggesting a reshuffling of reserves rather than an immediate sale. This activity occurred shortly after a new purchase, indicating active management of its bitcoin position, yet it had no significant impact on bitcoin's price, which held stable between $86,000 and $87,000.

feed.title: Trump Media & Technology Group (DJT) Stock Today: Fusion Merger Fallout, Bitcoin Rumors, and What Investors Are Watching on Dec. 23, 2025
feed.summary: Trump Media & Technology Group (DJT) experienced a volatile week ending December 23, 2025, driven by its unexpected announcement to merge with nuclear fusion firm TAE Technologies in a deal valued over $6 billion. The stock surged initially on the "fusion frenzy" but later saw a sharp sell-off as investors reassessed the long-term viability and timelines of a fusion energy business. Additionally, DJT faced a crypto-driven jolt from Bitcoin acquisition rumors which the company denied, further highlighting its susceptibility to narrative-driven trading and its digital-asset exposure.

feed.title: Trump Media shuffles Bitcoin holdings after crossing $1 billion mark, stash may have slipped below 10K BTC
feed.summary: This article discusses how Trump Media has shuffled its Bitcoin holdings, which previously exceeded $1 billion. This shuffling might have resulted in their Bitcoin stash falling below 10,000 BTC.

feed.title: DJT Stock News (Dec. 23, 2025): Trump Media Whiplash Continues After TAE Fusion Merger Surge—What Investors Are Watching Next
feed.summary: Trump Media & Technology Group Corp. (NASDAQ: DJT) is experiencing extreme volatility following a surprise $6 billion all-stock merger plan with nuclear fusion developer TAE Technologies. The stock saw a significant surge after the merger news, then gave back some gains, closing at $14.41 on December 22, down 10.44% for the day. Investors are closely watching the progress of the merger, which involves an all-stock transaction where TAE and TMTG shareholders are expected to own approximately 50% each of the combined company.

feed.title: Trump Media (DJT) Slashes 10.44% on Profit-Taking
feed.summary: Trump Media & Technology Group Corp. (NASDAQ:DJT) experienced a 10.44% drop on Monday due to profit-taking following its recent surge. This surge was driven by an announced $6 billion merger with TAE Technologies, aiming to create a publicly traded fusion company. The combined entity plans to begin construction of a utility-scale fusion power plant next year.

feed.title: Trump Media Bitcoin Holdings Hit 11,542 BTC
feed.summary: Trump Media & Technology Group has increased its Bitcoin holdings to 11,542 BTC, valued at over $1 billion, after a recent purchase of 451 BTC for $40.3 million. This move aligns with the company's strategy to become a Bitcoin-heavy investment vehicle, a trend also noted by BlackRock, which highlighted Bitcoin as a top investment theme for 2025. BlackRock's iShares Bitcoin Trust has seen significant growth, reaching $68 billion in AUM and $63 billion in net inflows.

feed.title: How a Trump Media Deal With a Crypto Firm Exposes Potential Conflicts of Interest
feed.summary: A deal between Trump Media and Technology Group and Crypto.com has raised concerns about potential conflicts of interest. Crypto.com, previously under investigation by the Biden administration, saw the probe dropped after Trump won the election, subsequently donating $11 million to Trump-affiliated political committees and engaging a lobbyist close to Trump. This arrangement is viewed by ethics experts as a "pay-to-play" scenario, where the crypto firm's financial support correlates with favorable outcomes from the administration and a lucrative partnership with Trump's company.

feed.title: DJT Stock Tumbles. Trump Media’s Pivot to Nuclear Fusion Is No Sure Thing.
feed.summary: Trump Media & Technology Group stock saw significant gains recently after announcing a merger agreement with nuclear fusion company TAE Technologies. However, investors are cautioned that the rally may not be sustainable, given the stock's volatile performance throughout the year. The article suggests that the pivot to nuclear fusion might not be a reliable path for sustained growth.

feed.title: A $6 billion nuclear deal has Trump’s name all over it. It’s raising serious ethics concerns
feed.summary: Ethics experts are raising concerns over a $6 billion merger between Trump Media & Technology Group and nuclear fusion company TAE Technologies, warning of potential conflicts of interest given Donald Trump's significant financial stake. The deal could result in the federal government playing favorites in the emerging clean energy sector, especially since fusion companies often require government funding and regulatory approval. Critics argue this situation deviates from historical presidential ethics standards and could create an unfair advantage for Trump-backed TAE.

feed.title: Trump Media’s $6 Billion Merger Plan Sparks ‘Conflict of Interest’ Concerns
feed.summary: A proposed $6 billion merger between Trump Media & Technology Group and fusion power company TAE Technologies has raised conflict of interest concerns, particularly given that TAE Technologies receives federal funding. Ethics experts highlight potential issues due to Donald Trump's significant ownership in TMTG and his political role. Critics suggest Trump should divest his interests to avoid the appearance of using his position to benefit his companies.

feed.title: Why Trump’s social media company is merging with a fusion power firm
feed.summary: Donald Trump’s social media and cryptocurrency company is planning a $6 billion merger with a fusion power firm, aiming to boost a new form of electricity generation. While this deal could advance fusion power technology, economists and ethics experts are raising concerns about potential conflicts of interest for the energy company involved. The merger highlights the complex intersection of technology, finance, and political figures.

feed.title: DJT Stock Went Nuclear. Here’s How Much the Trump Family Made.
feed.summary: Trump Media & Technology's stock surged 42% on Thursday, increasing the value of the Trump family’s holdings in the social media company by approximately $500 million. This significant boost to the family's wealth is attributed to the company's unexpected merger with TAE Technologies and its planned pivot to nuclear fusion.

feed.title: Trump Media (DJT): Is a 2x Price-to-Book Multiple Reasonable After the Recent Share Price Rebound?
feed.summary: Trump Media & Technology Group (DJT) has experienced a volatile period, with recent share price jumps contrasting with a year-to-date decline. Despite its price-to-book ratio of 2x appearing cheap compared to some peers, it's still above the industry average, suggesting a premium for its brand. However, significant operating losses and unproven long-term user growth pose risks to this "fragile optimism."

feed.title: Trump Media’s Fusion Partner Faced Claims Over Unpaid Bills
feed.summary: Trump Media & Technology Group Corp.'s planned merger with nuclear fusion startup TAE Technologies will infuse TAE with up to $300 million. However, court records indicate that TAE Technologies has faced multiple accusations of failing to pay suppliers and vendors, suggesting a need for the incoming funds. The merger will make TAE one of the first publicly traded fusion ventures.

feed.title: Trump Media Is a Loser in a Year Full of Winners
feed.summary: In a year of strong market performance globally, investors in Donald Trump's Trump Media & Technology Group Corp. have experienced significant losses. The article highlights this as another business failure associated with Trump, following a history of bankruptcies, and criticizes investing in his ventures.

feed.title: CEO of nuclear fusion firm Trump Media is merging with: High-velocity capital is 'critical' and concerns are secondary
feed.summary: Trump Media & Technology Group announced a $6 billion merger with nuclear fusion developer TAE Technologies, causing Trump Media's stock to spike despite TAE not expecting revenue until 2031. TAE CEO Michl Binderbauer views the deal as critical for accelerating clean energy development, emphasizing the need for "high-velocity capital" despite potential scrutiny. Critics, like Public Citizen's Robert Weissman, decry the merger as an unethical "cash grab" capitalizing on potential federal funding for a company with Trump family stakes.

feed.title: Trump Media, TAE Announce One of the Weirdest Mergers Ever. DJT Stock Is Soaring.
feed.summary: Trump Media, owner of Truth Social, has announced an unexpected merger with TAE Technologies, a firm focused on nuclear fusion technology. This move indicates an expansion of the Trump family empire into futuristic tech. The announcement has led to a significant surge in DJT stock.

feed.title: Trump's social media venture strikes $6B merger deal with fusion power company
feed.summary: Trump Media & Technology Group, the parent company of Truth Social, has agreed to a merger deal valued at over $6 billion with fusion energy company TAE Technologies. This all-stock transaction represents a significant expansion for Trump Media beyond its social media advertising business into the developing clean energy sector. The deal aims to create one of the first publicly traded fusion companies and begin building a utility-scale fusion power plant by 2026, though it has raised concerns regarding potential conflicts of interest on Capitol Hill.

feed.title: Trump Media announces $6 billion merger with nuclear fusion company
feed.summary: Trump Media & Technology Group (TMTG) announced a $6 billion merger agreement with nuclear fusion company TAE Technologies. The partnership aims to combine Trump's media firm with a next-generation energy production company, with TMTG shares soaring 35% on the news. The merged entity plans to construct the first utility-scale nuclear fusion power plant by 2026, despite skepticism about the commercial viability of fusion technology.

feed.title: Trump Media to merge with nuclear fusion company that wants to power AI
feed.summary: Trump Media & Technology will merge with TAE Technologies, a fusion power company, in an all-stock deal valued at over $6 billion. The combined entity plans to build the "world's first utility-scale fusion power plant" to provide electricity for artificial intelligence, with former Congressman Devin Nunes becoming co-CEO. This merger aims to create one of the first publicly traded nuclear fusion companies and signals a move towards powering energy-intensive AI data centers with fusion technology.

feed.title: Trump Media group buys fusion power company for $9bn
feed.summary: Trump Media & Technology Group, owner of Truth Social, has acquired fusion power company TAE Technologies for $9 billion in an unexpected move into energy. The all-stock deal aims to address the massive energy demands of AI by building utility-scale fusion power plants. Despite Trump Media's share price slumping, the announcement saw a significant jump, with the first plant planned for 2026.

feed.title: Not a ‘game changer’: What to know about Trump’s nuclear fusion deal
feed.summary: Donald Trump's social media company, Trump Media & Technology Group, is merging with fusion energy giant TAE Technologies in a $6 billion all-stock deal. This merger represents a significant financial bet on fusion technology, which despite decades of research, still faces substantial technical hurdles before commercial viability. While analysts believe this could boost funding for the nascent fusion industry, many do not see it as a "game changer" for developing a working power plant.

feed.title: Trump Media announces $6 billion merger with fusion company TAE Technologies; DJT stock soars 33%
feed.summary: Trump Media and Technology Group has announced an all-stock merger agreement with fusion power company TAE Technologies, valued at more than $6 billion. The deal, expected to close in mid-2026, caused Trump Media's stock (DJT) to jump 33% at the opening bell. This pivot aims to create one of the world's first publicly traded fusion companies, aligning with Trump Media's "America-first principles" and its strategy to embrace transformative technology.

feed.title: Is the Market Bullish or Bearish on Trump Media & Technology Group Corp?
feed.summary: Short interest in Trump Media & Technology Group Corp (NASDAQ: DJT) has decreased by 17.34% since its last report, indicating a potential shift towards a more bullish sentiment among investors. With 11.48 million shares sold short, representing 6.96% of available shares, it would take traders over two days to cover their positions. The company's short interest is also lower than the average of its peer group, suggesting a less bearish outlook compared to similar companies.

feed.title: Trump Media & Technology Group (DJT): Revisiting Valuation After a Steep Three-Month Share Price Slide
feed.summary: Trump Media & Technology Group (DJT) has experienced a significant share price decline of over 37% in the past three months, prompting a re-evaluation of its valuation. Despite trading at a 1.3x price-to-book ratio, marginally cheaper than peers but above the broader industry, the company still faces ongoing losses and uncertain revenue growth. Investors are urged to consider key risks and perform their own due diligence, as the stock's volatility and fading momentum necessitate a cautious approach.

feed.title: Trump Media & Technology Group (DJT): Revisiting Valuation After a Steep Three-Month Share Price Slide
feed.summary: Trump Media & Technology Group (DJT) has experienced a significant share price decline, falling 16% in the last month and over 37% in three months. Despite trading at a price-to-book ratio of 1.3x, which is slightly lower than peers but higher than the broader industry, the company faces ongoing losses and uncertain revenue growth. Investors are reevaluating its valuation amidst fading momentum and underlying risks.

feed.title: Trump Media Director: Rs 1 Lakh Cr Investment Promise for T'gana..
feed.summary: Eric Swider, Director of Trump Media and Technology Group Corp, announced plans to invest Rs 1 lakh crore in Telangana's 'Bharat Future City' over the next decade. Speaking at the Telangana Rising Global Summit, Swider highlighted India's growing prominence in the global technology sector. Telangana Special Chief Secretary Jayesh Ranjan also requested Swider to inform Donald Trump about a street in Hyderabad named after the former US President.

feed.title: America's most powerful banker attacks Trump company CEO: 'Stop making up things'
feed.summary: JPMorgan Chase CEO Jamie Dimon publicly rebuked Trump Media CEO Devin Nunes, dismissing claims that his bank "debanked" Donald Trump's media company due to political pressure. Dimon urged Nunes to "stop making up things", stating that Chase does not discriminate based on political or religious affiliations and only closes accounts for reasons such as fraud or compliance. Nunes had alleged that JPMorgan Chase cooperated with federal investigations by turning over financial records to the Biden administration without notice.

feed.title: Jamie Dimon Says He Doesn't Like 'Debanking People,' Denies Targeting Trump Media: 'People Have To Grow Up'
feed.summary: JPMorgan Chase & Co. CEO Jamie Dimon denied targeting Trump Media & Technology Group Corp., stating that the bank's actions were in response to court orders and not political affiliations. Dimon emphasized that JPMorgan does not "debank people for religious or political affiliations" and that they are legally obligated to comply with subpoenas for information. The article also touches on how the experience of being debanked influenced Donald Trump's family's views on cryptocurrency.

feed.title: Trump Media & Technology Group (DJT): Valuation Check After Settling Co‑Founder Legal Dispute
feed.summary: Trump Media & Technology Group (DJT) recently settled a legal dispute with co-founders, which could remove an overhang and sharpen its strategic focus. Despite a significant year-to-date share price decline, the settlement hints at easing negative momentum as legal risks reset. The company trades at a Price-to-Book of 1.4x, which is above the industry average but slightly better than a closer peer group, suggesting some speculative froth has diminished.

feed.title: Truth Social operator Trump Media settles legal dispute with co-founders
feed.summary: Trump Media announced an "amicable settlement" in its legal dispute with co-founders Andy Litinsky and Wes Moss, ending ongoing litigation. The co-founders, who pitched the idea for Trump Media in 2021, had previously sued for alleged stock dilution, a claim dismissed by a Delaware court. Details of the settlement have not been disclosed.

feed.title: Trump Media Stock and 11 More Tax-Loss Victims to Avoid Until 2026
feed.summary: This article identifies Trump Media & Technology Group stock and eleven other companies that investors should potentially avoid until 2026 due to tax-loss considerations. The author notes that the holiday season, while good for family, can be challenging for certain stocks.

feed.title: Glabe Scott, Trump media general counsel, buys $10,465 in DJT
feed.summary: Glabe Scott, General Counsel and Secretary of Trump Media & Technology Group (NASDAQ:DJT), acquired 1,000 shares of the company's common stock for $10,465 on November 18, 2025. Following this transaction, Scott directly owns 326,236 shares and has agreed to disgorge any statutory "profits" under Section 16(b). This comes as Trump Media expands its financial and digital asset offerings, including new "America First-themed" ETFs and a partnership to form a digital asset treasury company.

feed.title: DJT Stock Has Cratered, Wiping Out More Than $5 Billion in Trump Family Wealth
feed.summary: Trump Media & Technology Group's stock, trading under the ticker DJT, has fallen to all-time lows. This decline has reportedly led to a loss of over $5 billion in the Trump family's wealth. The company's performance is further impacted by the ongoing plunge in cryptocurrencies like Bitcoin.

feed.title: Trump Media Lost $54.8 Million Last Quarter As Bitcoin Bet Backfires
feed.summary: Trump Media and Technology Group, the parent company of Truth Social, reported a significant net loss of $54.8 million in the third quarter of 2025, largely due to a $48 million drop in its bitcoin holdings, despite some gains in Cronos. The company also incurred $20.3 million in legal fees related to its merger. With cryptocurrencies continuing to fall since the quarter's end, Trump Media is expected to face further substantial losses.

feed.title: Trump's social media company to launch prediction betting marketplace
feed.summary: Trump Media and Technology Group (TMTG) announced its plan to launch a prediction betting marketplace on Truth Social, enabling users to bet on sports and politics. TMTG CEO Devin Nunes stated this move aims to "democratize information" and facilitate "actionable foresight" by partnering with Crypto.com for beta testing. This initiative follows the growth of prediction markets and the Trump family's increasing involvement in this sector.

feed.title: Trump stock tanks after announcing massive share sale - AOL.com
feed.summary: Trump Media & Technology Group's stock dropped after the company announced a significant new share offering, which includes 21.5 million shares and aims to monetize shares related to its merger and warrants. While this move could help the struggling company financially, it threatens to dilute existing shares and has already caused a substantial decrease in former President Trump's net worth. The stock's volatility is attributed to its association with Trump, its meme stock status, and the company's precarious financial health.

feed.title: Crypto Skeptic to Cyber-Bull: The Stunning $870 Million Bitcoin Portfolio You Didn't Know Donald Trump Held! - NewsBreak: Local News & Alerts
feed.summary: Donald Trump, once a critic of Bitcoin, has reportedly amassed an $870 million indirect stake in the cryptocurrency through his media company, Truth Social's parent company, TMTG. TMTG has adopted a "bitcoin Treasury" strategy, investing $2 billion in Bitcoin and related securities, influencing its stock valuation. This shift aligns with Trump's pro-crypto policy agenda, including executive orders and legislation aimed at making the US a "crypto capital."
